channel.title: From-sheafies on Jon Sterling's Forest
channel.description: Recent content in From-sheafies on Jon Sterling's Forest

item.description: We will write $\TOP{E}$ for the meta-2-category of $E$-topoi.

Combining [unpublished: #frct-003C] and [unpublished: #frct-003D], the following are equivalent for a logical fibration $E$ of geometric universes over $B$: $E$ has small sums over $B$. $E$ is the gluing fibration for a cartesian morphism $B \to F$ of geometric universes.

item.title: 2-categories of geometric universes
item.description: Each of the different notions of geometric universe above gives rise to a 2-category. We will fix our conventions below: $\PCartGU$ is the 2-category of geometric universes, partial cartesian morphisms, and natural transformations between them. $\CartGU$ is the 2-category of geometric universes, cartesian morphisms, and natural transformations between them. $\LogGU$ is the locally groupoidal 2-category of geometric universes, logical morphisms, and natural isomorphisms between them. $\AlgGU$ is the 2-category of geometric universes and algebraic morphisms $f = (\InvImg{f}\dashv\DirImg{f})$, such that a 2-morphism $f \to g$ is given by a natural transformation $\InvImg{f}\to\InvImg{g}$.

item.title: Composing morphisms of topoi
item.description: Let $X,Y,Z$ be topoi over a geometric universe $E$ and let $f:X\to Y$ and $g:Y\to Z$ be morphisms of topoi; we will construct the composite morphism $f;g:X\to Z$. First of all, let us unfold assumptions into the language of $\AlgGU$. In particular, we have morphisms $\Sh{f}:\Sh{Y}\to \Sh{X}$ and $\Sh{g} : \Sh{Z}\to \Sh{Y}$, together with invertible 2-cells $\varphi_f,\varphi_g$ as depicted below: {%tex macrolib: topos%} \begin{ZX} \zxN{} &\dar[close]{X}\ \zxN{} &\zxX[pilr]{\varphi_f}\dlar[swap,-o,close]{Y}\drar[N,close]{\Sh{f}}\[3mm] \zxN{} & \zxN{} & \zxN{} \end{ZX} \qquad \begin{ZX} \zxN{} &\dar[close]{Y}\ \zxN{} &\zxX[pilr]{\varphi_g}\dlar[swap,-o,close]{Z}\drar[N,close]{\Sh{g}}\[3mm] \zxN{} & \zxN{} & \zxN{} \end{ZX} {%endtex%}

item.title: Composition of 2-cells between morphisms of topoi
item.description: Let $X,Y$ be a pair of topoi over a geometric morphism $E$ and let $f,g,h : X\to Y$ be morphisms of topoi; given 2-cells $\alpha : f \to g$ and $\beta : g \to h$, we will define the composite 2-cell $\alpha;\beta : f \to h$. First we unfold what we are given into the language of geometric universes; the morphisms of topoi unravel to the following morphisms and 2-cells of geometric universes: {%tex macrolib: topos%} \begin{ZX} \zxN{} &\dar[close]{X}\ \zxN{} &\zxX[pilr]{\varphi_f}\dlar[swap,-o,close]{Y}\drar[N,close]{\Sh{f}}\[3mm] \zxN{} & \zxN{} & \zxN{} \end{ZX} \qquad \begin{ZX} \zxN{} &\dar[close]{X}\ \zxN{} &\zxX[pilr]{\varphi_g}\dlar[swap,-o,close]{Y}\drar[N,close]{\Sh{g}}\[3mm] \zxN{} & \zxN{} & \zxN{} \end{ZX} \qquad \begin{ZX} \zxN{} &\dar[close]{X}\ \zxN{} &\zxX[pilr]{\varphi_h}\dlar[swap,-o,close]{Y}\drar[N,close]{\Sh{h}}\[3mm] \zxN{} & \zxN{} & \zxN{} \end{ZX} {%endtex%}

item.title: Explicit computations in the 2-category of topoi
item.description: In what follows, we will give explicit computations of the 2-categorical structure of $\TOP{E}$ in the language of $\AlgGU$. @include{0031} @include{0032} @include{0033} @include{0034}

item.title: Fibrations of geometric universes
Finite colimits, natural numbers objects, and logical functors
item.description: Note that any geometric universe has finite colimits, which can be constructed using the subobject classifier. A logical morphism between geometric universes necessarily preserves finite colimits for this reasons. Using Freyd’s characterization of natural numbers objects in terms of a coequalization property, it follows that logical morphisms also preserve the natural numbers object.

item.title: Geometric universe
item.description: A geometric universe $E$ is defined to be a finitely complete cartesian closed category with a subobject classifier and a natural numbers object.

item.title: Jibladze's Theorem
item.description: Let $E$ be a logical fibration of geometric universes over $B$; if $E$ has small sums over $B$, then these sums are stable and disjoint.

item.title: Logical fibrations of geometric universes
item.description: Let $B$ be a geometric universes; a logical fibration of geometric universes over $B$ is given by a fibered category $E$ over $B$ such that each that fiber category $E_u$ is a geometric universe and each restriction map $E_v\to E_u$ is a logical morphism.

item.title: Moens' Theorem
item.description: Let $E$ be a logical fibration of geometric universes over a geometric universe $B$. Then the following are equivalent: $E$ has stable and disjoint sums over $B$. $E$ is the gluing fibration for a cartesian morphism $B\to F$ of geometric universes. Indeed, in the situation described above we may define $F$ to be the fiber $E\Sub{\ObjTerm{B}}$ over the terminal object. The functor $B\to E\Sub{\ObjTerm{B}}$ sends each $b\in B$ to the sum $\coprod_{b}\ObjTerm{E}$.

item.title: Morphisms of geometric universes
item.description: We describe three different kinds of morphism between geometric universes. A partial cartesian morphism $f : E \to F$ is a pullback preserving functor $f:E\to F$. A cartesian morphism $f : E \to F$ is a partial cartesian morphism $f : E\to F$ that preserves the terminal object. A logical morphism $f : E \to F$ is a cartesian morphism $f : E \to F$ that additionally preserves the subobject classifier.

item.title: The identity 2-cell of a morphism of topoi
item.description: Let $X,Y$ be a pair of topoi over a geometric universe $E$, and let $f : X \to Y$ be a morphism of $E$-topoi; we will construct the identity 2-cell $\Idn{f} : f \to f$ in the hom category $[X,Y]$. First of all, we unfold the data that we are given into the language of $\AlgGU$: {%tex macrolib: topos%} \begin{ZX} \zxN{} &\dar[close]{X}\ \zxN{} &\zxX[pilr]{\varphi_f}\dlar[swap,-o,close]{Y}\drar[N,close]{\Sh{f}}\[3mm] \zxN{} & \zxN{} & \zxN{} \end{ZX} {%endtex%}

item.title: The identity morphism of a topos
item.description: Let $X$ be a topos over a geometric universe $E$; we will compute the identity morphism $\Idn{X}:X\to X$ in $\TOP{E}$ as a diagram in the meta-2-category $\AlgGU$ of geometric universes and algebraic morphisms. We will let $\Sh{\Idn{X}} : \Sh{X}\to \Sh{X}$ be the identity map $\Idn{\Sh{X}}$. The coherence $\varphi\Sub{\Idn{X}}$ is given by the identity 2-cell, as we have the equation $X; \Sh{\Idn{X}} = X$ in $[E,\Sh{X}]$: {%tex macrolib: topos%} \begin{ZX} \zxN{} &\dar[close]{X}\ \zxN{} &\zxX[pilr]{\varphi\Sub{\Idn{X}}=\Idn{X}}\dlar[swap,-o,close]{X}\drar[N,close,near end]{\Sh{\Idn{X}} = \Idn{\Sh{X}}}\[3mm] \zxN{} & \zxN{} & \zxN{} \end{ZX} {%endtex%} {%qed%}

item.title: Topos
